subject: Public Speaking
title: Adele's Pre-Show Anxiety
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Adele's Pre-Show Anxiety.

hook.text: Adele has sold over 120 million albums. She also vomits from stage fright before almost every live show.

buildup.text: She has described panic attacks, projectile vomiting, and once trying to escape through a fire exit before a concert.

discovery.text: Despite this, she performs anyway. She's said the fear never goes away â€” she just walks through it each time.

twist.text: Her visible nervousness on stage actually endears her to fans. They see authenticity, not weakness.

climax.text: Adele proves that mastery and anxiety can coexist. Being great doesn't mean being comfortable.

punchline.text: She throws up, then sings to millions. That's courage.

quiz.question: How does Adele manage her stage fright?
options: She performs despite it every time
